'''Anthony John Lewis''' [[Order of the British Empire|MBE]] (born 25 February 1942 in [[Bolton]], [[Lancashire]])<ref name="ESPNcricinfo - Tony Lewis - England">{{cite web|url=http://www.espncricinfo.com/ci/content/player/462884.html|title=Tony Lewis - England|work=[[ESPNcricinfo]]|publisher=[[ESPN]]|accessdate=31 December 2011}}</ref> is a [[mathematician]] who, along with [[Frank Duckworth]], developed the [[Duckworth-Lewis method]] of resetting targets in interrupted [[cricket]] matches.<ref name="Longmore1999">{{citation|title=First Night: Duckworth–Lewis: The odd couple getting even with the weather|journal=[[The Independent]]|date=16 May 1999 |url=http://www.independent.co.uk/sport/first-night-duckworthlewis-the-odd-couple-getting-even-with--the-weather-1093982.html | location=London | first=Andrew | last=Longmore | accessdate=25 May 2010}}</ref><ref name="Richards2003">{{citation|title=How two statisticians became stars|journal=[[New York Times]]|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2003/02/18/sports/18iht-cricket_ed3__6.html|date=18 February 2003 |  first=Huw | last=Richards | accessdate=25 May 2010}}</ref>

Lewis received degrees in mathematics and statistics from [[Sheffield University]] in the 1960s.<ref name="ima"/> In January 2008, he retired as a lecturer in Quantitative Research Methods from [[Oxford Brookes University]].  He was formerly a lecturer at the [[University of the West of England]] where the [[Duckworth-Lewis method]] originated from an undergraduate final-year project.  He is also a former chairman of the [[Western Operational Research Discussion Society]]{{Citation needed|date=June 2009}} and was a keynote speaker at the Second [[Institute of Mathematics and its Applications|IMA]] International Conference on Mathematics in Sport in 2009.<ref name="ima">[http://www.ima.org.uk/Conferences/maths_sport/keynote_speakers_lewis.html IMA Mathematics in Sport] conference web site.</ref>

Lewis was appointed [[Member of the Order of the British Empire]] (MBE) in the 2010 [[Birthday Honours]].<ref>{{London Gazette |issue=59446 |date=12 June 2010 |startpage=19 |supp=yes }}</ref>
